question:
In context with the Dutch East India Company, consider the following statements:
  1. Its authority was highly decentralized
  2. Its headquarters was pulicat
  3. Chief of Pulicat was known as Dutch Governor of India
Which among the above statements is / are correct?
explanation: In India, Pulicat was one of the seats of Dutch East India Company. Other was Negapattam. The first permanent factory was Masuli pattanam (1605). The chief at Pulicat was known as Dutch Governor of India, but the second statement is not correct. The headquarters of Dutch East India company was Batavia (Indonesia) and due to this, they had a very highly decentralized structure. This was one of the reasons of their downfall in India. So statements 1 & 3 are correct.
